page.title: 07LIVERPOOL AIRPORT.....
page.content: Liverpool Airport is situated about 7 miles from the city centre at Speke, adjacent to the north bank of the river Mersey. The airport was amongst the earliest established by a municipality, and one of the few to be found operating on the same site 50 years after its official opening, having been worked continuously during this time. The airport was officially opened in July, 1933, three years before Gatwick and thirteen years ahead of Heathrow. Liverpool Corporation commissioned Sir Alan Cobham to make aerial surveys for a municipal aerodrome in 1928, and the results pointed to Hooton Park on tne Wirral or Speke.
